Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Certainly \Cer"tain*ly\, adv. Without doubt or question; unquestionably. [1913 Webster]

certainly adv : definitely or positively (`sure' is sometimes used informally for `surely'); "the results are surely encouraging"; "she certainly is a hard worker"; "it's going to be a good day for sure"; "they are coming, for certain"; "they thought he had been killed sure enough"; "he'll win sure as shooting"; "they sure smell good"; "sure he'll come" [syn: {surely}, {sure}, {for sure}, {for certain}, {sure enough}, {sure as shooting}]
